channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13590] TestEnableTableHandler.testEnableTableWithNoRegionServers is flakey
item.description: Looking at our build history, it seems this test is flakey. See builds 429, 431, 439.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The three above all terminate after timeout with the following stack

junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: Waiting timed out after [60,000] msec table enabled in zk,

	at junit.framework.Assert.fail(Assert.java:57)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Waiter.waitFor(Waiter.java:209)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.Waiter.waitFor(Waiter.java:161)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.waitFor(HBaseTestingUtility.java:3772)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned(HBaseTestingUtility.java:3226)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseTestingUtility.waitUntilAllRegionsAssigned(HBaseTestingUtility.java:3177)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.handler.TestEnableTableHandler.testEnableTableWithNoRegionServers(TestEnableTableHandler.java:107)

Log shows region either fails to be assigned or fails to online.
Andrey Stepachev mind taking a look?
Nick Dimiduk I'll take it.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-1.1 #446 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.1/446/)
HBASE-13590 temporarily disable flakey test (ndimiduk: rev 6ed238756ea0abe24ee0c6d9f87b277e47c61437)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/handler/TestEnableTableHandler.java

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-1.1 #458 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.1/458/)
Revert "HBASE-13590 temporarily disable flakey test" (ndimiduk: rev 6e546a516cfa64d51fa4e2d81bd1c264476a7c17)

  • hbase-server/src/test/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/handler/TestEnableTableHandler.java

yeah, finally got a different exception:

Tests run: 3, Failures: 1, Errors: 0, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 40.651 sec <<< FAILURE! - in org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.handler.TestEnableTableHandler

testEnableTableWithNoRegionServers(org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.handler.TestEnableTableHandler)  Time elapsed: 13.329 sec  <<< FAILURE!

java.lang.AssertionError: expected:<2> but was:<1>

	at org.junit.Assert.fail(Assert.java:88)

	at org.junit.Assert.failNotEquals(Assert.java:743)

	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:118)

	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:555)

	at org.junit.Assert.assertEquals(Assert.java:542)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.handler.TestEnableTableHandler.testEnableTableWithNoRegionServers(TestEnableTableHandler.java:110)

Quite interesting...
You still looking at this Andrey Stepachev?
Nick Dimiduk no, sorry, don't working on that for now.

Nick Dimiduk we encountered exactly the same problem with 1.1.2, and after a carefully debug we've made sure it's the same as reported in HBASE-13041, and since patch for HBASE-13041 only goes into trunk, branch-1 still has the problem.

We were able to see this UT failure stably at a one-tenth chance by running below cases together: TestMasterOperationsForRegionReplicas,TestEnableTableHandler,TestRateLimiter,TestSplitTransactionOnCluster, and confirmed no failure happened in a 100-times round after the patch.
Submit the patch to see what HadoopQA will say

-1 overall

Checking the UT failures and findbugs/asflicense warnings, I don't think any is relative to the patch here.
HBASE-13041 or similar wasn't already picked up in stack's latest rounds of bug squishing? Wonder why he and Sean aren't seeing it on branch-1.2.
Yeah, looks like TestEnableTableHandler passed in the above Jenkins run. 100 times passed after the patch sounds good to me; +1.

Hey Nick Dimiduk (HNY!). I took a look at the HBASE-13041 patch (as opposed to this patch) and what is in 1.2 and it seems that the spirit of this patch is already in 1.2 (didn't dig to see provenance). I see that in 1.2 we do assign via master as this patch suggests and I also see an assert that this patch removes commented out with an explanation on why the assert is incorrect:

commit e568cda7f05880577b27a8e693f8788cae372596
Author: stack <stack@apache.org>
Date: Mon Oct 5 22:33:45 2015 -0700

HBASE-14559 branch-1 test tweeks; disable assert explicit region lands post-restart and up a few handlers

The above change went into 2.0, 1.3, and 1.2 (didn't do 1.1 and before).

Yu Li Looking at the patch... (It only applies on branch-1, not to branch-1.1... is that your experience?)

Why do we have to do this when we just enabled the table a few lines up:


+    List<HRegionInfo> regions = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseAdmin().getTableRegions(tableName);

+    assertEquals(1, regions.size());

+    for (HRegionInfo region : regions) {

+      TEST_UTIL.getHBaseAdmin().assign(region.getEncodedNameAsBytes());

+    }

Otherwise, patch looks good to me.

stack Thanks for checking this.

These lines follow the same logic as the code in trunk (or say the original patch in HBASE-13041). I think they are doing the same thing as the original m.getAssignmentManager().assign(admin.getTableRegions(tableName));. I'm ok to roll back these lines to the single line one, but just would like to mention that the 100 times run I executed was with current patch, although it should be the same in theory. Just let me know if you insist.

According to our investigation, regions would get assigned during regionserver start, and the same regions assigned again by the later codes. The two assign plan conflict somehow thus cause the hang. And I think the real fix in the patch is the cluster.waitForRegionServerToStart line

Honestly, I have no idea why we should assign the regions again after regionserver is up. IMHO design of this test case is to make sure that table enabled when no RS up could get assigned after RS come back, so the second assign-action seems useless to me.

If you make a version of the patch with a comment that has your 'Honestly...' comment in it... I'll commit it since you've run the patch 100 times and it passes. If you don't mind, put up a 1.1 patch to and I'll apply that also. Thank you.
Update patch according to review comments and upload patch for branch-1.1

I applied patch to branch-1 and to branch-1.2. When I tried the 1.1 patch, I get this:

I applied patch to branch-1 and to branch-1.2. When I tried the 1.1 patch, I get this:

Oops... But I see you've commit the patch, anything happened later or you just leave the JIRA open for me to further debug sir stack? I launched my test script against branch-1 latest code and it passed for the first 20 rounds, will check branch-1.1 in parallel and get back here with the result.

HNY to you as well stack! Thanks for coming around to help make sense of these tests.

Yu Li ... and confirmed no failure happened in a 100-times round after the patch

I took this to mean you'd run your patch on branch-1.1 100x. I missunderstand? I'm pulling your patch and taking it for a spin along with the friends you mention above. Will report back how it fares.

Some misunderstanding... I ran our 1.1.2 100x with the same changes, but the first patch here was made against branch-1. My fault that didn't upload a branch-1.1 patch from the very beginning. The later uploaded patch for branch-1.1 is the same with our 1.1.2 one, so feel free to play with it.

btw, I checked our UT log this morning but found it cleaned up, so it's a pity that I cannot supply the original 100x results any more. Since the patch is already commit, I'm pulling the latest code and now running 100x round separately against branch-1 and branch-1.1, will come back with the new result later today.
Thanks a lot Yu Li. Let's get it verified and in for 1.1.3

Attaching the 100x test result for branch-1, confirmed TestEnableTableHandler no more fails. 100x test for branch-1.1 is still in progress, will update later.

According to current branch-1.1 result, have logged HBASE-15120 to fix TestSplitTransactionOnCluster failure

Attaching the 100x test result for branch-1.1 with patch attached here, also confirmed no failure of TestEnableTableHandler. However, have observed below failed cases:

Failed cases Failure times
TestSplitTransactionOnCluster#testFailedSplit 24
TestRateLimiter#testOverconsumptionFixedIntervalRefillStrategy 1
TestMasterOperationsForRegionReplicas#testCreateTableWithMultipleReplicas 1

Have opened HBASE-15120 for TestSplitTransactionOnCluster#testFailedSplit.
For TestRateLimiter, we have a fix for our 1.1.2 branch, and will open a JIRA to fix it later.
For TestMasterOperationsForRegionReplicas, need to locate the root cause

The script I used for both branches:

#!/usr/bin/env bash



count=0

while ((count < 100))

do

  count=$(expr $count + 1)

  echo "=====Round $count====="

  mvn -Dmaven.test.redirectTestOutputToFile=true \

   -Dit.test=noItTest \

   -Dhbase.skip-jacoco=false \

   -Dmaven.test.failure.ignore=true \

   -Dtest=TestAsyncProcess,TestMasterOperationsForRegionReplicas,TestEnableTableHandler,TestRateLimiter,TestSplitTransactionOnCluster \

   -Dsurefire.testFailureIgnore=true \

   clean test

done

stack, about the truth that it failed at the first run with the branch-1.1 patch when you tried earlier today, is it possible that it was some kind of env issue?... Please let me know your thoughts on how to move on here, thanks.
ping stack Nick Dimiduk, any comments on the verification test result? Thanks.
Coming back to this one. Yu Li You think the other failures you mention above are unrelated? I say we take it and let it stew.
Reattaching patch for branch-1.1 QA Bot.

Checking javadoc report, nothing introduced by the change here.

Checking UT result, no failed case but below error message at end of report:

[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-surefire-plugin:2.18.1:test (secondPartTestsExecution)

on project hbase-server: There was a timeout or other error in the fork -> [Help 1]

which seems like an env issue.

which seems like an env issue

Indeed. Ran on H4, not H2 (the known flakey host). Looking at it's build history I don't see many passing hbase unit test runs. Any thoughts Sean Busbey stack? Can we trust this host?

TestEnableTableHandler passed even in the above failed run. Let me post once more. If it passes again for both JDK's, I say commit.

It says in the jira comment from yetus that there was a timed out test:

JDK v1.8.0_66 Timed out junit tests org.apache.hadoop.hbase.namespace.TestNamespaceAuditor

earlier, this would have been reported by teh zombie detector

Checking javadoc report, nothing introduced by the change here.

Please check carefully that this is the case and ensure there is an open jira for any extant jdk8 javadoc errors. Javadoc under jdk8 has been working in the past and I would really like to avoid having to dig out what is failing come release management time again (I've already done it twice).
